 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְפָר‎</span>] **proper name, of a location** ==in South Arabia==; — only with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ה‎</span> locative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְפָ֫רָה‎</span> [[Gen.10.30|Gen 10:30]], [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Σωφηρα</span>; usually indentified with <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ˆafâr***</u></abbr> (<img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, pronounced <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, according to [[BDB#Thes|Thes]]), ancient city of Himyarite kings ([[BDB#Ptol|Ptolemy]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Σαπφαρ</span> <span class="bdbLangGreek">μητρόπολις</span> see Sprenger<sup>Aite Geogr. Arab. § 301 et pass</sup>.), so [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] [[BDB#Tu|Tu]]<sup>Comm. Gen. 2, 212</sup>, but dubious [[BDB#Gl|Glaser]]<sup>Skizze ii. 437</sup>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צ‎</span> improbable [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>on the passage</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 61</sup>.
